Description: Ivory amulet in form of female figure, glazed green. Standing nude figure modelled in the round; she stands on small base, her arms straight to her sides, and there are holes pierced through under the arms and between the knees. The hairstyle resembles one popular in Egypt but the figure is Phoenician in style.
Bibliographic references: Barnett & Mendleson 1987a / Tharros; A Catalogue of Material in the British Museum from Phoenician and other Tombs at Tharros, Sardinia (2/25)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2007-2008 6 Oct-20 Apr, Paris, L'Institut du Monde Arabe, 'Phoenicians and the Mediterranean'.
